data.title: Great quality and value
data.body:
We took down our 60" TV off the wall because we upgraded, but we had no clue where the original stand was for the LG TV, so I did some researching and decided upon this stand. I'm happy with my purchase. It's super solid, simple to assemble, and looks great.
We do have the TV set on the lowest it can be set on the stand. There's a lot of room under there, so if someone has a sound bar or streaming box they need to keep underneath, then no worries, the clearance is plenty.
The swivel is a great feature in a room where one may sit in different chairs or need to adjust due to sunlight streaming through a window.
There were plenty of extra pieces for various sized/brands of televisions. It was no problem matching the correct screws to our TV, and now we have extras to put in our "spare parts" box for that "I can use that one day" mantra.

data.title: Definitely recommended
data.body: This mount is very well made and certainly ample for our 40inch TV. Impressively well-written and illustrated instruction manual accompanies the wide array of hardware that makes this item capable of accommodating a wide range of TVs. Wide range of positioning options. We opted to position the TV near the upper range of vertical placements and it is still quite stable. Easy to rotate side to side without fearing it will topple off our furniture. Heavy 'black' glass base is nice touch. Worth the price.

data.title: Excellent! Somewhat tough 1 person job, but better w/o my spine injury!
data.body: UPDATE: My mistake on the "does NOT tilt 8° up or at all. It DOES. Once I was finished with installing everything, including what I thought was the last step, and securing the tv in the stand, I stopped reading the instructions. The last step at the end of the instructions booklet shows you what to do to tilt the tv upward. I also mistakenly thought it could tilt DOWN as well-down was what I wanted, not up, by MY error. Perlgear responded via email almost immediately just from my review- I never contacted them directly- with an attached pic of the directions I ALREADY HAD. My mistake and excellent customer service by Perlegear! I LOVE THIS TV STAND!! Will be buying another for sure. First review: This was a very difficult 1 person (who's not mechanically inclined and physically disabled due to spine injury/surgeries) job, but doable. If I can do it, just about anyone can! I am VERY pleased with the result although I specifically chose the one with 35° side swing and 8° upward tilt. It does NOT tilt upward AT ALL. I can do without. DIRECTIONS(💯), screws/washers/wrench labeled/bagged separately was excellent and made what goes where easy to understand. Directions appeared to be done by one with English as their native language, big plus. If not for TCL covering the top 2 of 4 of the necessary holes with screws, wasting an hour on the phone with them to determine if my brand new TCL 50" would work, it would've made it a MUCH shorter job than 2+hrs. I'm feeling the PAIN from having to do this alone, but you gotta do what you gotta do. I would like to personally thank those who had the great recommendation in Amazon Answers to lie the TV face down on a bed to attach it to the stand itself(as well as attaching the brackets to the back of the tv first). The final step of attaching the TV to the assembled stand was the most painful(again, for me) but was a quick part of all the steps thankfully. At just $29 with its sturdiness, excellent directions, items' identification, and finally its wonderful, flexible position for my new TV rather than those ridiculous wide fragile "legs" that come with the TV, are ALL reasons I HIGHLY recommend this or any Perlegear TV stand. I'll be buying another one to put my old 40something inch TCL that still works into another room now!

data.title: Good Solid Stand
data.body:
I wasn't sure how good this stand would be, but it seems to be strong and sturdy.
It supports my old 50" Plasma TV that weights almost 60 LBS just fine.
Comes with all the hardware you will need to assemble the stand, and several different screws and spacers for mounting the TV. Assembly was quick and easy.
The TV sits fine and the balance is good. So far I don't see any issues with the TV tipping over.
Make sure your TV mounting holes are within the VESA patten (3.9x3.9 to 15.7x15.7inch). Most TVs should be fine. My TV was at the very outer limit of this spec. I had to use the very end holes in the mounting brackets, this was not a problem, everything lined up perfect.
The base is flat smooth glass 15.75x10.25inch
The swivel to turn the TV is easy to move.
Some other reviews noted problems with the instructions. I had no issues, they were easy for me to follow.
I am happy with this stand.

data.title: Great TV mount, just no negative tilt
data.body: I got this for a TV that was missing a stand in my bedroom. It is connected via VESA 200x200 mounting. The TV stand came with everything needed for installation and then some. I even was able to use the leftover washers and screws in another project. The setup was very fast and simple. After following the instructions for about 10-15 minutes I was done mounting my 37" LCD. While it can tilt upwards, I just wish that it would tilt downwards too, but I haven't been able to find a stand like that, only wall mounts. I also wish I could adjust it a little lower too. But, other than that, I would highly recommend it. My TV is now sturdier than ever with this Perlegear stand. With the tempered glass base, it looks great too.

data.title: Impressed
data.body: This is a very nice stand. The old saying in....."you get what you pay for" does not apply here. You actually getting far more bang for the buck in this stand. I have paid and bought five different stands for my TV's in the past for much more because I prefer stands then the two-sided end feet's that comes with the TV's now. I mounted this stand to a 50 inch TV and couldn't be more satisfied. It comes with all the screws and hardware for mounting it with a curved back or a flat back panel. The instructions are super easy to follow. After mounting my TV, I was surprised how lightweight it was after mounting it and it was rock solid, it's not going anywhere planted. The swivel and tilt on the stand are a bonus, will look for Perlegear TV stands in the future.....not going to go there but paid way too much for what I already have in comparison that does the same thing.

data.title: Perfect and at a good price
data.body: I am very happy with this product. It works well and it looks great. It is made of very good quality and it comes with everything so you can set your tv, screws of all sizes and extras.

data.title: Very well made and packaged
data.body: Pretty easy to assemble. You should read all of the directions first, some of the part (screws) labeling is a little confusing but everything was there that I needed. All parts fit together very well and the TV stand looks very good after it is assembled. I would definitely buy another if I needed one.

data.title: Tempered Glass Base Corner was broken
data.body: I bought this product quite some time ago and was finally able to install it as intended. Until I opened the packaging, I was unaware the base was glass. Admittedly, I did not read the entire description, but paid attention to the highlighted materials as alloy steel. Regardless, although the base had a damaged corner, I decided to keep it and assemble the stand with my TV. The damaged glass is esthetically noticeable, it does not affect the purpose or strength of the stand. The stand is nearly as heavy as the TV. I am very happy with the mounting and flexibility of the stand and believe it to be the best product to meet my needs. The packaging could use some extra padding to protect the corners of the glass, but that is my only complaint.

data.title: Just what I wanted
data.body: This is a very heavy duty stand and was a perfect replacement for those flimsy feet that come with the tvs. The very last step in assembly was a little confusing-the one where you install the screws to lock in the tv. This wasn't a super easy assembly by any stretch of the imagination and it came with a lot of parts in plastic bags. It took me about an hour and a half to complete it because I was unfamiliar with the workings of tv mounts. The only thing I would say to watch out for is the heighth. I've put this on top of a high boy type dresser and it may have put the tv a little higher than I thought I wanted at the lowest install level.

data.title: Stability
data.body:
I use this with a 40 inch Hisense Roku TV.
The only problem I had was hanging the TV on the frame I am not able to tighten it down because of the design of my television. There's a hump in the center of the back of the TV which is wider than the narrowest point I can place the hanging clips which means basically it's hanging off the rack rather than locked to it. It works perfectly fine this way but if you have children or animals I would recommend checking to ensure you can lock it down.

data.title: Easy to install, sturdy and supportive tv stand.
data.body: I have installed and use this now for a couple months and super happy with it. I have a LG Electronics 65SK8000 65-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV (2018 Model) that I bought here on amazon years ago that just isn't high enough on the credenza I have it on and my neck is always bothering me. After looking around at various tv stands, I came across this one and decided to purchase it. The installation was pretty easy enough, though I suggest having a second pair of hands to help lift your tv, etc. I like that I can use my credenza now to have plants or books on it, and the stand is not noticable as I have my playstation 5 on the glass base so it kind of hides that I'm even using a stand. My neck is more comfortable when watching tv now that its at a higher position. It's pretty durable and sturdy, feels very secure.

data.title: Slotted holes in upper half of support pillar were punched at the wrong end.
data.body: Easy-to read instructions with good diagrams. I took my time putting it together and should have had it done in under an hour, but! The slots in the pillar extension were punched in the wrong end and there was no way of getting it to work without drilling new holes. I hadn't read about this kind of defect in any other reviews so maybe I'm just the lucky one. I should have returned it but my new TV was begging to be mounted. It took me an extra hour to carefully mark, punch and drill new holes before I could continue. The stand seems strong enough to support the weight of a large TV, but I went ahead and heeded the recommendations that came with the TV to secure the top of the pillar to the back of the table with a cable. I set up my new 55" TV at the lowest height that the stand would allow and have six and a half inches clearance underneath.

data.title: Easy to assemble and mount the TV, works great
data.body: This stand was a lifesaver for me I was contemplating having to mount a wall TV holder to hold our new LG 55-inch TV and suspend it over our TV stand that we wanted to keep as a furniture item. This item kept me from having to measure precisely where to mount the wall mount to accomplish the TV stand look over the existing TV stand table. Easy to assemble and mount the TV on.

data.title: Sturdy Stand and swivels left and right
data.body: I was skeptical at first with this stand. I have an older 55" TV which has the glass frame and is fairly heavy. I was unable to hang this TV on the wall. After assembling the stand which was quite easy - I put the TV on it and Voila... It held and is pretty sturdy. (Make sure you use the locking bracket and screws.)

data.title: A lot nicer than the stock legs that came with my TV.
data.body: Purchased two new smart TV's that come with the little V feet that are way too far apart for the tables I use. These are almost perfect but wish they would tilt down. They only tilt up. Not a big deal.

data.title: Convoluted instructions, but otherwise a solid stand.
data.body: Got this for my 55 inch Samsung Q60 QLED. It fits it perfectly and seems pretty sturdy and solid. I consider myself to be a fairly capable and intelligent person, that being said, I have never had trouble assembling or fixing anything in my life from electronics to vehicles. However, the instructions on this are fairly confusing and somewhat convoluted. I did manage to figure it out though and I am pleased with it.

data.title: Good product
data.body: I bought 2 stands. The first one was easier to assemble because the back of the tv was flat. The second stand was not as easy as there was an extra panel in the back. I am happy with the stands.

data.title: Swivel Stand
data.body: The best swivel TV stand by far. It is the perfect TV stand for people who do not want to put their TV on a wall.

data.title: Great tv stand for the price.
data.body: I like the Swivel feature the most about this tv stand but while putting it together one of the screws on the base of the stand would not tighten and just spun around loose. I was disappointed in that and considered returning it but I decided to keep it for now. I will probably buy a new one eventually because it does hold my 43" Samsung TV a little higher than I was hoping for at the lowest position I could get it to go.

data.title: Sturdy and easy to assemble
data.body: I bought this because I moved to a new rental house and didn't want to put holes in the walls mounting my TV. My old tv’s legs were longer than the with of the mantle so I’m glad I found this unit which fits with a tiny bit of space to spare. The unit is sturdy and holding my 65”/50 lbs tv easily. I would buy this again in the future.

data.title: Tall
data.body: Used for 65” TCL. The mounting hole are very low on these tvs. With it as low as possible the bottom of tv was about 10” above table top which was too high for me. I went to work and cut 5” off, made of steel, not hard to modify. Really they should make it with another segment that can be removed. Also flipped the upper mount upside down so it would tip out instead of back. Sturdy and well made.

data.title: Very good flat screen TV stand
data.body: This TV stand does the job. The anchors provided to keep the television from sliding off the bar could have been designed better. I used two cheap but effective clamps to hold the TV in place. Works way better.

data.title: Great product!
data.body: Very simple to put together. Very good instructions. My 65” tv is totally stable. I would buy it again!

data.title: Barely worked
data.body: This stand barely fit for my 65" tv. The support on the stand is 17" wide and the spacing for the support bars that go on the back of my TV are 16 3/4" wide. This only gave me a quarter of an inch left. That being said, my TV only weighs 37 lbs and this stand has no issues supporting it. I wish it didn't have a tempered glass bottom and they easily break like my last one. I literally dropped the bottom onto the carpet and it shattered. All tabletop stands are made with glass, I don't get it.

data.title: A good tv stand
data.body: I was looking for something that would raise my tv slightly. It is an awsome.l stand. Although assembly took 45 minutes, once assembled it had a great finish and was really sturdy to hold my tv. It swivels left right and height can be adjusted which was a bonus.

data.title: Exactly what I wanted
data.body: It’s perfect. I didn’t want to mount the tv on the wall so this gives it the same effect as if it was

data.title: Good TV stand
data.body:
Good and sturdy. However, need to have better instructions and parts labeled better to assemble.
Also, need to be able to pick the exact size of stand to be able to adjust the height of the TV on this stand.
Good communication with support team.

data.title: Easy to install.
data.body: This is a very sturdy mount for your big tvs. It was easy to install because all parts were well labeled.

data.title: Very sturdy and easy to assemble.
data.body: Very sturdy and easy to assemble. Item is somewhat heavy making it very stabile.

data.title: Product is as described
data.body: All parts (with extras for adjustments) were included. Reasonably easy to assemble. Fits TV& hides wires. Nice base. Would definitely recommend.

data.title: Very sturdy tv stand
data.body: This tv stand is very sturdy and well made. My tv is 50” and it is on the lowest setting. There are like 8 slots to put the screws in to attach the braces to the TV. The top of the braces hang over the tv stand and then 2 screws hold them together. Probably will adjust 4-5 inches up or down. according where you attach the brackets. The A larger tv would set lower to the furniture you set it on. Easy to put together. Followed a you tube demonstration and that helped a lot. Would purchase again.

data.title: Easy to put together and use.
data.body: We were pleased with the ease of the instructions and how it was put together. Very sturdy for our 57" guest room TV.

data.title: SUPERB Value But Not Perfect
data.body:
Needed to raise my new tv up so I could fit my headphone stands & amplifier all on the top shelf of the rack..Holy crap this sucker is TALL..I have the tv on the top most adjustment level & get a full 11" underneath..
It seems stable & sturdy enough..Not terrible to put together but not a slammer job either..Points DEDUCTED for 2 way tape attachment of rubber feet under tempered glass base..
At a savings of almost $50.00 from what Best Buy wanted to sell me I'm pretty happy with purchase..

data.title: Solid Quality in Every Way
data.body: Best purchase for the smaller TV I have at the moment. Solid construction. Easy assembly. Would definitely recommend

data.title: Good stand
data.body: Stand works as advertised. It holds my C3 just fine and allows it to be high enough my 2 year old son cant reach it. Wall Mount was out of the question thanks to the utilities sharing that wall. Good solution.

data.title: Perfect!
data.body: Loved this purchase! Product description is accurate, and stand is exactly what I was looking for! Easy to install and very sturdy! Would definitely recommend!

data.title: The base is heavy and glass-just be aware!
data.body: Heat TV stand for so cheap. I was surprised to find the base is rather heavy and glass. I thought I read the description before buying but somehow missed that. It’s not a bad thing, it’s a well put together stand and very strong. It’s nice and had a low profile with great swivel so it can turn right or left to accommodate where you are sitting in the room. I couldn’t hang my TV on the wall in my room so I needed a TV stand since the feet were missing from TV and it couldn’t stand up by itself. Perfect solution!

data.title: Very sturdy
data.body: Not so easy to assemble. It seems sturdy and stable. I like the fact that it swivels

data.title: Amazing
data.body: If you are thinking about buying this stand do it.

data.title: Works as advertised.
data.body: I had it put together and the TV attached in under half an hour. Three weeks later the only problem I have is what to watch.

data.title: It does support heavier LCD screens works well with a 65 inch pivots left to right well.
data.body: A little concerned while assembly of the two rear sections that connect the top to the bottom half of the I-beam where the two bolts connect on one side they should've put two more on the other other than that very stable and nicely made.

data.title: 75 in TV fits and remains stable
data.body: I was not sure how a 75 in TV would work on this stand. After assembling it and mounting the TV, I was surprised just how sturdy it is. Being a 75 in TV it is at the highest point on the stand and remains stable, a smaller TV would not be a problem for this stand.

data.title: Nice Stand
data.body: Very easy to set up works great for my outdoor tv set up sturdy stand

data.title: Excellent TV stand
data.body: Very strong and solid. Operates well. Our TV is 50 inches, only 30 lbs. Capacity of this unit is up to 88 lbs. Putting it together is not trivial but there is good tech support. I called them a couple of times along the way. There are lots of different size screws and plastic washers and spacers provided, and you have to figure out which to use and which to discard when you are done. Be sure to follow instructions all the way to the end. This is my second TV stand.

data.title: Looks and work good.
data.body: Installation a bit time consuming, because it's supposed to be universal stand. They include a lot of bolts sizes to fit different TVs. When is done looks and works good. It has some hight adjustment, but I wished there was more, so I could hang my TV lower, but not a big deal. Good robust product for this price.

data.title: Very functional
data.body: I love this TV stand it fits perfectly.

data.title: Does it’s job
data.body: Holds up a 65” good no problem

data.title: Great tv stand
data.body: Great stand!! Holding my 65” screen with ease

data.title: Great product.
data.body: Easy to assemble. My 55" looks great.

data.title: works great
data.body: I bought a new 65" tv and installed the little legs that came with the tv....I really didn't want to mount it on the wall but didnt really care for the cheap legs that came with the tv because when they were on the tv the distance between the legs was wider than my tv stand...then I found this tv stand mount on amazon at a great price....it was easy to put together and sits nicely in the middle of my tv stand,,,it mounts to the tv the same way a wall mount does...very happy with my purchase as usual from amazon..

data.title: Better than I expected!
data.body: Easy to assemble, adjustable height. Highly recommend

data.title: Good
data.body: Fast delivery and easy to put together

data.title: very nice stand
data.body: Easy to install, works great, would buy again

data.title: It works great and doesn't take up a lot of room I love it
data.body: I love my TV stand it's perfect for my 65 inch TV

data.title: Easy to put together
data.body: It was very easy to install and you can do it by yourself

data.title: Great stand, very solid, easy on the wallet - no brainer
data.body: I used this for a 55" LG TV and it fits perfectly, looks great and had all the screws and spacers needed. It's also solidly designed with thick aluminum tubing. Assembly took 15-20 mins from start to finish and I used the top-most hook, placing the bottom of the TV about a foot above the console. Perfect. Wish I'd found this a year ago when I got the TV. Already have another in the cart for another TV in another room.

data.title: Love it
data.body: It was large enough to hold my 65 inch tv. I have an entertainment center that was maybe about 4 inches too small for my TV but I love that center, paid a lot for it and it matches my furniture. So instead of replacing it I decided to try a stand.

data.title: 10/10 and easy to assemble
data.body: I am very pleased with this option and it fit on my 70'' really well. You need 2 people to lift it, but I like that the tv turns depending on where you're sitting in the living room.

data.title: Works well
data.body: Easy to put together. Worked appropriately.

data.title: easy use
data.body: works perfect glad i got it

data.title: Got for my mom
data.body: Worked great expect I put it on upside down at first lol. Outside of my error it works great highly recommend. Good price good quality

data.title: great product!
data.body: installed on my new 65” television. fits perfectly…safe and easy to install!

data.title: TV stand
data.body: I needed to move my TV from a wall mount to a location on a table. This stand was easy to mount my 48 inch TV on. The stand has height and tilt adjustments and is very sturdy.

data.title: 55 inch tv
data.body: Looks great easy to install

data.title: Works great
data.body: Got this for a 65 inch flat screen. Fixture fits good and is stable when set on the TV stand. This is the second one that I have bought and would buy again. For this installation I did use the safety straps that were ordered separately.

data.title: Works as intended
data.body: Adjustable and acually made TV look larger

data.title: Great item
data.body: Works great. Easy to put together

data.title: Height booster
data.body: I use this as a stand for a a 43 inch television.

data.title: Fantastic stand
data.body: Easy to assemble and I love how it swivels. We turn it towards the kitchen when eating and then turn it back towards the family room after we clean up! I love this stand! I highly recommend it!

data.title: Decent universal stand
data.body: Alot cheaper than buying a used oem stand from Ebay. Shipping was within hours, not days. Looks good in extra br, used the base for a DVD player to sit on.

data.title: Works
data.body: Works and fits perfect

data.title: Simple but Attractive Design
data.body: I love the height this gives my tv. East to assemble and very attractive with the pretty base. And if I'm ever not happy with the height, I can easily lower the tv. VERY HAPPY with it.

data.title: good stand
data.body:
I bought this because I knocked a month old 32" set off the table and broke it. I thought this might happen and I wish I bought this before I had to buy another TV. Really, don't use the flimsy legs that come with your TV, because anything that can go wrong, generlly will go wrong.

It was pretty easy to assemble once I understood there was a lot of extra hardware for TVs that are designed differently. Mine was the most basic and went together with in about 35 minutes. It's very stable and reasonably attractive.

I would buy it again.

data.title: Ease of Assembly
data.body:
Once I got my mind into instructions interpretation mode, assembly went well. The step by step instructions were clear and concise. Instructions include acceptable line drawings.

The engineering seems well thought out. I don't understand the plexiglass base. The base feels stable. I wish it had included anti-tilt / fall over tethers / straps. I would prefer it sat lower than its minimum height. The swivel is nice and is very smooth.

All in all, at this point, I recommend this product.

data.title: great buy
data.body: great buy

data.title: Works great for Roku tvs
data.body: I love this stand!! It fit my 55in Hisense Roku tv perfectly and is amazing. I’ve always hated the Roku’s flimsy and WIDE stands that barely allow the tv to fit on different types of furniture. Now I can put my tv on any surface, adjust the height, and the swivel feature is GREAT! It’s very durable and well made. it takes awhile to set up but that’s because it’s a universal stand so there are many leftover parts you won’t use after you determine which parts are intended for your tv. Instructions were also slightly difficult for me to follow along but I figured it out lol one of the best purchases on Amazon!!
Buenisimo

data.title: Excellent stand
data.body: Very easy to put together, I like how all the screws & washers were separated & marked so easy to distinguish. It is very sturdy. My only wish is that I would like to be able to adjust the height lower. I can’t use the 2nd one I purchased because it sits too high in my alcove.

data.title: Good, solid TV stand
data.body: Needed a solid stand for a new TV. This one fit the bill.

data.title: Love this stand!
data.body: I love this purchase! Turns your TV into a computer monitor setup, allows for great control left to right turning, but no tilt up or down function for obvious stability reasons. Makes watching things from my bed so much easier. Love it!

data.title: The perfect answer to our problem
data.body: Easy to put together, takes about 30 minutes (15 if there are 2 people). Sturdy and great looking. The ability to swivel and tilt helps a lot. So far no complaints and nothing but compliments from everyone that sees it. Great product.

data.title: Nice sturdy stand
data.body: It’s definitely a sturdy stand and very simple to put together. I only wish that the TV could be lowered another 2 inches or so other than that I would highly recommend it.

data.title: Bought for the future
data.body: Says can take up to 70 inch TV will find out some day

data.title: Nice stand
data.body: Nice stand if you are looking to put your TV on a narrower table or stand and not have to worry about the feet on the TV not fitting. Used this on 55" and it worked well. Stand height for the TV is higher than I anticipated, even on the lowest setting level. If you are putting on top of a fireplace or higher type TV stand, you may want to take notice of this.

data.title: Looks great
data.body: I was worried that it would not hold the TV. Works great. Recommend for placement when you can’t hang your television

data.title: Looks better with a TV on it!
data.body: It enjoyed this more once I put a 65" TV on it - be sure to do that. My big hog 65" TV is not too heavy or tipsy- this stand holds up. I now watch my TV while eating recipes from Dr. Shawn Baker's "The Carnivore Diet" book.

data.title: Money saver!!!
data.body:
We have used this item for many years! Let's you buy larger
tv's without having to buy larger more expensive entertainment
centers!

data.title: Perfect for our bedroom tv
data.body:
We needed to have the TV higher up but we don't trust the walls to hold much. This was the perfect solution.

It's on a chest and it does a great job making the TV more visible.

data.title: Sturdy for my 55" TV
data.body: Inexpensive and yet it solved my problem. Has many extra parts though.

data.title: Sleek and sturdy
data.body: It was easy to assemble and looks quite nice. There were more than enough screws for the various set up options. It was put together within 15 minutes.

data.title: Does the job!!
data.body: Most tvs now have the legs on the sides instead of the center which requires specific furniture for those tvs, however if you don’t want to wall mount your tv and make holes on your wall, this tv stand is perfect for you to use, I have my 55” tv on a small single drawer furniture and with this stand, it sits perfectly on it.

data.title: Very sturdy stand
data.body: We have a 50 inch tv and this stand is very sturdy for it. Nice that we can swivel it in our big family room. Took a few minutes to figure which screws to use, but overall we are pleased with this. The TV is now higher than before and that is ok!

data.title: Solid TV stand
data.body: Easy to assemble, simple and understandable instructions. Unlocking the swivel mechanism was very hard but doable. Overall I'm pleased with the stand. I wish height was more adjustable or the extra collar was removable.

data.title: Great!
data.body:
Easy to set up and easy to adjust if needed. I love it. :)
And it holds 50 inch just fine!

data.title: Works great for our TV
data.body:
Easy to put together, and came with a lot of extra parts depending on how you wanted to use it, which I appreciate.

The stand feels substantial and we’ve had no issues out of it.

I did help someone set this exact product up for their TV, which was 65”, and you will certainly need at least two people for that. The stand tends to move ever so slightly as you are trying to mount it, so that was a little tedious. I did not notice this on our smaller TV, as it was easier to handle.

data.title: Sturdy stand
data.body: Arrived on time, was reasonably easy to assemble. Package had extra bolts and gadgets to ensure that the stand would fit most tvs. Only issue, and my reason for deducting a star, is that the tv was not level when on stand, just slightly off. I had to use a few extra washers under the feet on one side to make it level.

data.title: Easy build
data.body: Exactly what I needed had fun building with girlfriend.

data.title: Gggg
data.body: I like everything about this product!! Not too difficult to assemble!!

data.title: Perfect
data.body: Easy setup and application. Holds a 70” on a table top
